headline: Government waives part of a Biden-era fine against Southwest Airlines
summary: The U.S. Department of Transportation is waiving part of a fine assessed against Southwest Airlines after the company canceled thousands of flights during a winter storm in 2022.  Under a 2023 settlement reached by the Biden administration, Southwest agreed to a $140 million civil penalty.  The government said at the time that the penalty was the largest it had ever imposed on an airline for violating consumer protection laws.

content.title: Government waives part of a Biden-era fine against Southwest Airlines
content.summary: The U.S. Department of Transportation is waiving part of a fine assessed against Southwest Airlines after the company canceled thousands of flights during a winter storm in 2022.  Under a 2023 settlement reached by the Biden administration, Southwest agreed to a $140 million civil penalty.  The government said at the time that the penalty was the largest it had ever imposed on an airline for violating consumer protection laws.

headline: Trump Administration Waives Biden-Era Fine Against Southwest Airlines
summary: Southwest Airlines  is off the hook for an $11 million payment imposed by the Biden administration related to its 2022 holiday meltdown, according to a Transportation Department order issued Friday.  In 2023, after a monthslong investigation, the Biden administration’s DOT issued a civil penalty for Southwest’s violations of consumer protection laws.  Instead, the directive issued Friday gives Southwest a waiver of $11 million.

content.title: Trump Administration Waives Biden-Era Fine Against Southwest Airlines

Instead, the directive issued Friday gives Southwest a waiver of $11 million.
